label: Title tag quality
description: Clear, descriptive title with sensible length and brand signal.
why_it_matters: Titles are the strongest machine signal for page focus. Clear, branded titles increase click-through, snippet quality, and reduce entity confusion.
how_to_fix: 1) Keep 15–65 chars. 2) Lead with the topic/intent; end with brand on key pages. 3) Use one primary keyword; avoid stuffing. 4) Make each page title unique.
common_issues: Missing <title>; duplicated across many pages; over 70 chars; vague marketing taglines; keyword stuffing; brand only with no topic.
quick_fixes: Export duplicate titles; rewrite to Topic – Brand; trim to <65 chars; add primary intent term.

label: Meta description present
description: Meta description exists and is within recommended length.
why_it_matters: Improves snippet quality and sets expectations for users/assistants.
how_to_fix: Add 50–160 character summary that echoes the H1 topic.
common_issues: Missing tag; too short/long; generic marketing copy.
quick_fixes: Draft succinct, factual summary that answers 'What is this page?'

label: Single H1 tag
description: Exactly one H1 indicating the main topic of the page.
why_it_matters: A single H1 clarifies the primary topic for parsers and users.
how_to_fix: Ensure exactly one H1; move extra H1s to H2/H3.
common_issues: Multiple H1s from templates; missing H1 entirely.
quick_fixes: Refactor templates to output one H1 per page.

label: Answer-first hero section
description: Clear value proposition and a primary CTA above the fold.
why_it_matters: Directly answers intent and improves assistant-ready summaries.
how_to_fix: Add a concise claim and an actionable CTA in the hero.
common_issues: Vague hero copy; CTAs buried; jargon-heavy messaging.
quick_fixes: Rewrite hero to state problem→solution and add a primary CTA.

label: Semantic heading structure
description: Proper H1→H2→H3 hierarchy without skipping levels.
why_it_matters: Consistent hierarchy improves parsing and accessibility.
how_to_fix: Use one H1; nest sections with H2/H3 in order; avoid H1→H3 jumps.
common_issues: Skipped levels; styling headings with divs; multiple H1s.
quick_fixes: Correct heading levels; convert styled divs to semantic tags.

label: FAQ section present
description: Detectable FAQ/Q&A block on the page.
why_it_matters: Improves answer engine coverage and structured snippets.
how_to_fix: Add an FAQ section with 3–5 concise, user-language questions.
common_issues: Q-like headings without answers; accordion without content.
quick_fixes: Write direct answers under each question; avoid fluff.

label: FAQPage schema
description: Valid FAQPage JSON-LD with 3+ Q&A pairs.
why_it_matters: Enables rich results and better assistant extraction.
how_to_fix: Add FAQPage JSON-LD aligning to the visible FAQ section.
common_issues: Invalid JSON; mismatched Q/A; fewer than 3 entries.
quick_fixes: Validate JSON-LD; mirror on-page questions and answers.

label: Internal linking & diversity
description: Adequate internal links with diverse, descriptive anchors.
why_it_matters: Improves crawl depth, context, and topic connectivity.
how_to_fix: Add 10+ relevant internal links; avoid repetitive anchors.
common_issues: Thin linking; nav-only links; 'Learn more' anchors everywhere.
quick_fixes: Add contextual links with specific anchors to pillar pages.

label: Canonical URL correctness
description: Canonical tag present and points to same domain.
why_it_matters: Prevents duplicate content and consolidates signals.
how_to_fix: Add absolute canonical to the preferred URL on same host.
common_issues: Missing tag; cross-domain canonical; querystring canonicals.
quick_fixes: Point to clean, final URL on same domain.

label: Mobile viewport tag
description: Viewport meta with device-width for responsive layout.
why_it_matters: Ensures mobile-friendly rendering for users and crawlers.
how_to_fix: Add <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">.
common_issues: Missing tag; fixed-width layouts.
quick_fixes: Add viewport meta; verify responsive CSS.

label: Language/region tags
description: HTML lang attribute matches the target locale.
why_it_matters: Improves geo/locale targeting and assistant comprehension.
how_to_fix: Set <html lang="en-US"> (or correct locale) on each page.
common_issues: Missing/incorrect lang; inherited from non-US templates.
quick_fixes: Update template root tag to correct locale.

label: No blocking robots directives
description: No 'noindex' or overly restrictive robots meta directives.
why_it_matters: Blocking directives prevent assistants and crawlers from using content.
how_to_fix: Remove 'noindex' where not required; review robots policies.
common_issues: Environment flags left on; inherited meta from staging.
quick_fixes: Strip 'noindex' for production; verify robots rules.

label: Organization entity graph
description: Organization/LocalBusiness schema with logo and 2+ sameAs links.
why_it_matters: Strengthens entity recognition and brand disambiguation.
how_to_fix: Add Organization JSON-LD with name, logo, and at least two sameAs profiles.
common_issues: Missing logo; no sameAs; name mismatch vs. title/H1.
quick_fixes: Add logo URL and social profiles; align org name across tags.

label: Open Graph basics
description: Presence of og:title, og:description, og:url, and og:image.
why_it_matters: OG tags improve sharing previews and help assistants disambiguate content.
how_to_fix: Add og:title, og:description, og:image, and og:url pointing to the canonical URL.
common_issues: Missing og:image; og:url not canonical; descriptions too long.
quick_fixes: Add a 1200×630 image; keep descriptions concise.

label: Primary CTA above the fold
description: Detects a clear Contact/Pricing/Signup CTA in the hero section.
why_it_matters: Strong CTAs increase conversions and clarify page intent for assistants.
how_to_fix: Add a prominent button or link in the hero with action-oriented text.
common_issues: CTA buried below fold; vague labels like 'Learn more'.
quick_fixes: Use 'Get started', 'Contact sales', or 'Book a demo' in the hero.

label: Related questions block
description: Detects a Q&A/related-questions section with multiple questions.
why_it_matters: Question clusters boost answer coverage and snippet depth.
how_to_fix: Add a 'Questions' section with 3–5 user-language questions and concise answers.
common_issues: Only 1–2 questions; no answers; marketing fluff.
quick_fixes: Use short, direct answers; mirror real queries ('how', 'what', 'why').

label: H2 coverage (content-per-section)
description: Measures the % of H2s with ≥100 characters of body content following.
why_it_matters: Sections with substance improve topical completeness and parsing.
how_to_fix: Expand thin sections so most H2s have at least a paragraph of content.
common_issues: H2s followed by only images or one-liners.
quick_fixes: Add a ~2–4 sentence explainer under each H2.

label: Core Web Vitals hints
description: Heuristics: lazy images, key font preloads, and limited blocking CSS.
why_it_matters: Better LCP/CLS proxies improve assistant eligibility and UX.
how_to_fix: Add loading="lazy" to below-the-fold images; preload primary webfont; trim large render-blocking CSS.
common_issues: All images eager-loaded; no font preloads; huge inline CSS.
quick_fixes: Lazy-load non-critical media; add <link rel="preload" as="font"> for the main font.

label: Topic depth & semantic coverage
description: Evaluates semantic completeness using LLM topic embeddings.
why_it_matters: Assistants reward pages covering related intents and co-occurring terms.
how_to_fix: Add supporting subtopics, examples, and related terms to show comprehensive understanding.
common_issues: Shallow coverage; missing related concepts; overly narrow focus.
quick_fixes: Expand with related questions, examples, and semantic variants.

label: Entity graph completeness
description: Measures the presence of internal links and schema connections between entities.
why_it_matters: Strong schema and links help assistants understand how your entities relate.
how_to_fix: Add Organization, Product, or Person schema and connect via sameAs or URL references.
common_issues: Isolated schema; no entity relationships; missing sameAs links.
quick_fixes: Connect entities with bidirectional schema references.

label: Canonical fact URLs
description: Stable URLs and anchors for key facts or product specs.
why_it_matters: LLMs cite at the fact level; canonical URLs improve retrievability.
how_to_fix: Ensure fact-rich pages and anchors remain stable and linkable.
common_issues: Changing URLs; missing fragment IDs; no deep-link anchors.
quick_fixes: Add stable #anchors to key facts and avoid URL restructuring.

label: Page speed (LCP)
description: Largest Contentful Paint below 2.5s target.
why_it_matters: Page speed influences engagement and crawl efficiency.
how_to_fix: Optimize media, preconnect to key origins, use lazy-loading.
scoring_approach: Automated HTML and performance timing proxy
common_issues: Slow LCP (>2.5s); unoptimized images; blocking scripts; no CDN.
quick_fixes: Compress images; add preconnect; defer non-critical JS.

label: Q&A scaffold
description: Detects visible FAQ or Q&A blocks that match structured schema.
why_it_matters: Explicit question-answer pairs improve snippet extraction and citation likelihood.
how_to_fix: Add 3–5 Q&A blocks and mark up with FAQPage schema.
common_issues: No Q&A; schema mismatch; questions without answers; buried below fold.
quick_fixes: Add visible Q&A with FAQPage JSON-LD; place above fold on key pages.

label: FAQ coverage (site)
description: Share of crawled pages that include a detectable FAQ block.
why_it_matters: Broader FAQ coverage increases assistant answer surfaces across the site.
how_to_fix: Add concise FAQ sections to major templates and key landing pages.
common_issues: FAQ only on homepage; thin answers.
quick_fixes: Roll out FAQ to product, pricing, and key service pages.

label: FAQ schema adoption (site)
description: Share of pages with valid FAQPage JSON-LD (≥3 Q&A).
why_it_matters: Schema adoption scales rich-result eligibility across the site.
how_to_fix: Mirror visible FAQ blocks with valid FAQPage JSON-LD.
common_issues: Invalid JSON; <3 entries; mismatch with on-page content.
quick_fixes: Validate JSON-LD and align entries to visible FAQ.

label: Canonical correctness (site)
description: Share of pages with valid, same-host canonical tags.
why_it_matters: Consistent canonicals consolidate authority.
how_to_fix: Ensure all templates emit absolute, same-host canonicals.
common_issues: Missing or cross-domain canonicals in certain templates.
quick_fixes: Fix template partials; remove querystring canonicals.

label: Mobile-ready pages (site)
description: Share of pages with proper viewport meta.
why_it_matters: Mobile readiness is table stakes for ranking and UX.
how_to_fix: Ensure all templates include a correct viewport meta tag.
common_issues: Legacy pages missing tag; inconsistent template usage.
quick_fixes: Audit templates; add viewport to base layout.

label: Correct lang/region (site)
description: Share of pages whose HTML lang matches target locale.
why_it_matters: Locale correctness improves international targeting.
how_to_fix: Set the correct lang attribute on all templates.
common_issues: Mixed locales; inherited defaults.
quick_fixes: Normalize root <html lang> across templates.

label: Entity graph adoption (site)
description: Share of pages with Organization/LocalBusiness schema set correctly.
why_it_matters: Consistent entity signals strengthen brand understanding.
how_to_fix: Roll Organization JSON-LD across core templates with logo and sameAs.
common_issues: Home only; missing sameAs; inconsistent names.
quick_fixes: Unify schema across templates; add ≥2 sameAs profiles.

label: Duplicate titles (site)
description: Percent of pages sharing a duplicate <title> across the crawl.
why_it_matters: Duplicate titles reduce relevance and dilute signals.
how_to_fix: Template titles with variables; ensure unique, topic-led titles.
scoring_approach: Aggregate of page titles from C1_title_quality details
common_issues: Category archives and paginated lists share the same title.
quick_fixes: Inject differentiators (product name, city, category).

label: Average H2 coverage (site)
description: Mean H2 coverage ratio across crawled pages.
why_it_matters: Stronger sections across templates improve topical depth.
how_to_fix: Raise minimum body content under each H2 in common templates.
common_issues: Template sections with headings but no body copy.
quick_fixes: Add copy blocks below H2s; avoid image-only sections.

label: OG coverage (site)
description: Share of pages meeting the OG basics threshold.
why_it_matters: Consistent OG improves social previews and link sharing.
how_to_fix: Propagate OG partials across templates with canonical URLs.
common_issues: Some templates omit og:image or og:description.
quick_fixes: Standardize OG component and pass canonical URL to og:url.

label: CTA above-the-fold (site)
description: Share of pages with a detectable CTA near the hero.
why_it_matters: Clear calls-to-action boost engagement and outcomes.
how_to_fix: Add primary CTA buttons to hero across key templates.
common_issues: CTA only on a few pages; text-only links.
quick_fixes: Use button components with action verbs site-wide.

label: Internal link health (site)
description: Share of pages meeting internal link quantity/diversity thresholds.
why_it_matters: Healthy internal links improve crawl and topic discovery.
how_to_fix: Add contextual links to pillar and hub pages; diversify anchors.
common_issues: Only nav/footer links; repetitive 'learn more' anchors.
quick_fixes: Add in-body links with descriptive anchors.

label: Sitemaps & discoverability
description: Valid XML sitemap with fresh lastmod dates and full coverage.
why_it_matters: Fresh, accurate sitemaps help assistants discover new and updated content quickly.
how_to_fix: Regenerate sitemap.xml regularly; include canonical URLs and lastmod attributes.
common_issues: Stale lastmod; missing pages; 404 entries; no sitemap index.
quick_fixes: Automate sitemap generation on publish; validate weekly.

label: AI bot access status
description: Verifies whether major AI crawlers are allowed in robots.txt and headers.
why_it_matters: Explicitly allowing GPTBot, Claude-Web, and Perplexity improves visibility in AI systems.
how_to_fix: Update robots.txt to allow relevant AI agents and verify header parity.
common_issues: All AI bots disallowed; conflicting rules; no explicit allow.
quick_fixes: Add explicit User-agent rules for GPTBot, Claude-Web, CCBot, PerplexityBot.
